meanings.definition: The act of speaking maliciously and falsely about someone.
meanings.sent1: The traducement of my character by the gossiping neighbor was hurtful.
meanings.sent2: The politician faced traducement from his opponents during the election campaign.
meanings.sent3: The traducement about my pet unicorn being a dragon was so silly.
meanings.sent4: Her traducement of his abilities as a chef was like a poisoned arrow.
meanings.sent5: The traducement spread like wildfire, staining my reputation irreparably.

meanings.definition: A false statement made to damage someone's reputation.
meanings.sent1: She spread traducement about her coworker to get ahead.
meanings.sent2: The traducement in the tabloids caused a lot of drama.
meanings.sent3: His traducement that he could fly like a bird was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The traducement was a dagger aimed at his good name.
meanings.sent5: The traducement echoed in the halls, tarnishing his image forever.
